newsitem.title: DUBAI: GOLF-WOOSNAM LEADS BY ONE AFTER GREAT FINISH.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-WOOSNAM LEADS BY ONE AFTER GREAT FINISH.

text.p: Ian Woosnam produced an eagle-birdie finish to snatch a one-shot lead with a five-under-par 67 in the third round of the Desert Classic on Saturday.
Woosnam pitched his second shot at the 351-yard 17th into the hole on one bounce from 110 yards out for an eagle two, then made a birdie four at the last to reach 13 under par.
Bernhard Langer could not birdie the last and finished one behind after a 68, level with Australian lefthander Richard Green, a 26-year-old from Melbourne who carded a six-under 66.
Defending champion Colin Montgomerie squandered several birdie opportunities including chances on the last three greens but emerged with a 68 for sole possession of fourth place on 11 under.
World number one Greg Norman shot a 67 to take a share of fifth spot on 10 under with Irishman Raymond Burns, Swede Klas Eriksson and Briton Malcolm Mackenzie.
Spaniard Jose Maria Olazabal continued his fine comeback from chronic foot problems to post a seven-under-par 65, a superb round that drew plaudits from the others.
"It was excellent. He's out there to win. He's walking well and you can see he wants to win," Woosnam said.
Olazabal is tied for 11th, five shots off the lead.
